Key Arguments: The submission questions who will have the authority to determine what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
It argues that truth is subjective and can change over time, suggesting that no individual or group can be the ultimate arbiter of truth.
The submission emphasizes the importance of free speech and open debate in discovering truth.
Notable Quotes: "For a nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people." – John F. Kennedy
"What appears to be today’s truth is frequently tomorrow’s error." – Sir Robert Menzies
